sentence.Network_en: Reliance on sponsorship can have a malign effect on theatre groups.

sentence.Network_en: Universities are turning from academic to commercial sponsorship.
sentence.Network_cn: 各大学正从学术赞助转而寻求商业赞助。

entry.tran: 资助(金);赞助(金);资金支持
entry.def: Sponsorship is financial support given by a sponsor.

example.ex: Campbell is one of an ever-growing number of skiers in need of sponsorship...
example.tran: 坎贝尔是越来越多需要得到资助的滑雪运动员之一。

example.ex: Private sponsorships only accounted for a third of all arts funding last year.
example.tran: 个人赞助只占去年所有艺术基金的三分之一。

entry.def: Sponsorship of something is the act of sponsoring it.

example.ex: When it is done properly, arts sponsorship can be more effective than advertising.
example.tran: 如果方式得当的话，艺术赞助可能比做广告更有效。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of sponsoring (either officially or financially)

Sentence.sentence: The bid went instead to Fuji, which exploited its sponsorship to win a permanent foothold in the marketplace.

sentences.en: sponsorship for next year’s World Cup
The company has decided to withdraw from some of its sports sponsorship.
sentences.cn: 这家公司已决定撤销部分体育项目的赞助。

sentences.en: Any sponsorship deal would be scuppered if Jones misses the Olympics.
sentences.cn: 如果琼斯不能参加奧运会，赞助商的所有赞助协议都会化成泡影。
